Name: androgynous
Description: Partly male/partly female appearance; of indeterminate sex.

Name: aromantic
Description: Experiences little or no romantic attraction to others.

Name: asexual
Description: Experiences little or no sexual attraction to others.

Name: autosexual
Description: Sexually attracted to themselves or prefers self-gratification over other forms of sexual activity.

Name: bear
Description: Hairy, heavy-set gay or bisexual man and those who are attracted to them.

Name: bisexual
Description: Attracted to two or more genders or attracted to more than one gender

Name: butch
Description: Lesbian who dresses, acts, or speaks in traditionally “masculine” ways.

Name: demiboy
Description: Partially, but not wholly, identifies as a man or boy, regardless of their assigned gender at birth.

Name: demigirl
Description: Partially, but not wholly, identifies as a woman or girl, regardless of their assigned gender at birth.

Name: demisexual
Description: Doesn’t experience sexual attraction without a strong emotional connection with that person.

Name: genderfluid
Description: Gender identity changes over time, or any other combination of binary and non-binary identities.

Name: genderqueer
Description: Doesn’t subscribe to conventional gender distinctions and identifies with neither, both, or a combination of male, female, or other genders.

Name: intersex
Description: Born with a reproductive or sexual anatomy that doesn’t fit the typical definitions of female or male

Name: lipstick-femme
Description: Lesbian who favors glamorous or traditionally feminine style.

Name: lithromantic
Description: Romantic attraction toward others but only enjoys romantic relationships in theory. Also known as an akoiromantic or apromantic.

Name: neutrois
Description: A non-binary gender identity which is considered to be a neutral or null gender.

Name: nonbinary
Description: Identifies as neither male nor female but a different gender entirely.

Name: omnisexual
Description: Romantically, emotionally, or sexually attracted to persons of all genders and orientations.

Name: original-pride
Description: Original 1978 version of gay pride flag.

Name: polyamory
Description: Romantic relationships involving more than two people, but with the knowledge and consent of all involved.

Name: polysexual
Description: Attracted to multiple (though not necessarily all) genders.

Name: pride-poc-inclusive
Description: Variation of gay pride flag inclusive of PoC

Name: progress
Description: LGBT Pride flag including PoC and Trans solidarity.

Name: Qpoc
Description: Variation of gay pride flag centering diversity

Name: queer
Description: This is for you to define for yourself.

Name: quiromantic
Description: Not understanding or actively disidentifying with romance/romantic attraction/romantic orientation as sensible/applicable categories, personally

Name: skoliosexual
Description: Attracted to gender expressions other than cisgender.

Name: transgender
Description: Identifies as a gender that differs from the one assigned at birth.

Name: trigender
Description: experiencing exactly three gender identities either simultaneously or alternately.

Name: twink
Description: Homosexual male with attractive, boyish qualities.

Name: twospirit
Description: culturally distinct gender that describes Indigenous North Americans who fulfill one of many mixed gender roles found traditionally among many Native Americans and Canadian First Nations indigenous groups.

Name: fetish
Description: Possesses a habitual erotic desire for an object, behavior, (nongential) part of the body, concept, or feeling.
